fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60134].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Release Page only has a preset of warnings does not allow for configurable warnings or alerts. See  [Using the release page to check the progress of a version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver070/using-the-release-page-to-check-the-progress-of-a-version-762877547.html] for reference.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow more customizable warnings to be preset by users. 
For example, allow each type of the currently-available warnings to be further configurable based on issue types.
A typical use case for this is certain tasks such as Documentation tasks do not require code reviews, so it doesn't need to be a warning for such issue types.

 
h3. Workaround 
Create a label system that mirror the warnings you would like to see in the release page. Create a process to mark issues with labels and create a dashboard based on filters that parse the issues into a logical group of said warnings.
fields.summary: Add customization to release warnings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60121].
  {panel}

SEN-2648176
My JIRA is configured with two LDAP directories. Typically each user account only exists in one directory.  However we have one user who moved regions, and thus his account was disabled on one directory and recreated on the other:

LDAP1\JSMITH (inactive)
LDAP2\JSMITH

From the logs we can see that JIRA first attempts to authenticate against LDAP1, it finds the account but authentication fails.  JIRA does not fall through and attempt the next directory, but rather gives up entirely, advising the user that their "username and password are incorrect".

If I switch the order of the directories, the user is able to log in.  However this is not a feasible solution; LDAP1 is first for performance reasons.  Also other users may migrate in the other direction.

Since it appears to be a standard domain sysadmin practice to deactivate the old account when moving users between LDAP directories, I believe JIRA should check the Inactive state of the LDAP account and if it is inactive, it should try the next user directory.
fields.summary: Inactive LDAP account does not trigger a fall-back to the next user directory.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60120].
  {panel}

Our project allows anonymous comments (as intended), however occasionally comments are added anonymously simply because the user did not realize they were not logged in. An enhancement I would like to see is a clearer indication that the comment will be anonymous, with perhaps an option to login within the comment box. At a minimum some sort of warning that the comment will be anonymous would be useful.

h3. Problem Definition
No warning to notify users that they aren't logged in and they will be making a comment anonymously

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a notification such as 'you are about to make an anonymous comment, would you like to login'
fields.summary: Anonymous comment notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some words using the like operator (~) in JQL do not provide results, whereas the actual data available in the dataset should be a reason for issues to get displayed.

h3. How to Replicate
# Create a Text Field (single line) custom field called "testfield"
# Create a couple of issues and populate the Text Field (single line) field with any of the following text: it, the, they, a, an
# Create a couple of issues and populate the Text Field (single line) field with the following text: ita
# Run an advanced JQL query similar to: testfield ~ it (or any of the other words as displayed in step 2)

The expected result is that this displays the relevant issues after running the query. Fact is however, that it will not provide any results at all.
When enabling debug level logging on {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers}} the following will be displayed in logs:
{code}
2016-03-08 13:57:56,691 http-nio-8080-exec-16 DEBUG admin 837x3144x2 1y73tiz 192.168.49.54 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable [c.a.j.i.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider] JQL query: {testfield ~ "it"}
2016-03-08 13:57:56,691 http-nio-8080-exec-16 DEBUG admin 837x3144x2 1y73tiz 192.168.49.54 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable [c.a.j.i.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider] JQL lucene query: +() +nonemptyfieldids:customfield_10101 +visiblefieldids:customfield_10101
{code}

Running the nearly same query "testfield ~ ita" provides significant different results:
{code}
2016-03-08 13:58:05,482 http-nio-8080-exec-13 DEBUG admin 838x3146x2 1y73tiz 192.168.49.54 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable [c.a.j.i.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider] JQL query: {langdetect ~ "ita"}
2016-03-08 13:58:05,482 http-nio-8080-exec-13 DEBUG admin 838x3146x2 1y73tiz 192.168.49.54 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable [c.a.j.i.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider] JQL lucene query: +customfield_10101:ita +nonemptyfieldids:customfield_10101 +visiblefieldids:customfield_10101
{code}

Tests have been run on JIRA Core 7.1.1
So far the following words have been identified to be impacted by this
* it
* the
* they
* a
* an
Other words might also be impacted, but we have not yet been able to find a common cause that would help us identify these words.
fields.summary: "like" operator (~) does not work with certain words (it, the, they, a, an)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60111].
  {panel}

When a user is trying to Select a field to  add as column in the issue navigator page > List View and they have  a lot of fields with the same name(or who share similar characters), JIRA would sort this in ascending order with the ones starting with A coming first before the closest fields that match the value searched.

This issue is most perplexing when they have lots of fields with the word searched as JIRA has a limit to how many words are shown.

*Expected Result*
JIRA should present the fields that are exact matches first before other results or allow users the option to increase the number of fields returned.

*Actual Result*
JIRA shows the fields that match the word searched in ascending order and has a limit so users  would not be able to see other fields that come later.
fields.summary: Column Search Issue Navigator

As a JIRA Administrator, I want to edit shared filters that are owned by other users.

Currently a shared filter can only be edited by the shared filter's owner, not even a JIRA Admin can edit one.  However, a JIRA Administrator can:

# Change the owner of the filter to themselves
# Modify and save the filter
# Change the owner back to the original

This is a tedious workaround to something JIRA Administrators should be able to do without extra steps.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Administrators to edit shared filters owned by others

h2. Current situation
At _Project > Administation > "Users and roles"_ I have to click on "Add users to a role" on the top right in order to add uses to a new role or to a role that has already been added.

h2. Problem
The user interaction of this administration functionality appears to be not intuitive.

h2. Suggestion
# The text links "Add users to a role" and "Edit defaults" should be replaced with buttons. To me, a text link indicates that I can go somewhere (change the page of a website) not triggering an functionality.
# To add a role that has not been filled with users for the project I still must use the "Add users to a role" button
# To add users to a role where users are already added I can choose the following two options:
## I can use the "Add users to a role" button
## At the very top of a role list (e.g. between ADMINISTRATORS and the list element where all users and groups are listed) there is a single line text input field where I can simply enter the name of an additional user and I can submit the user by pressing the ENTER key
fields.summary: More intuitive design for adding roles in "Users and roles"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60103].
  {panel}

h2. Current situation
Under _Project > Administration > "Users and Roles"_ one can assign users to roles which are not used by the permission scheme of the project.

h2. Problem
Sometimes, it is difficult for a project administrator to know which roles are relevant for a project or let's say used by a project's permission scheme.

h3. Suggestion
*As a project administrator, I can add users to roles that are used by the project's permission scheme only so that I don't have to look up the permission scheme to know which roles are relevant.*

It may be like this:
* Users can be added to roles that are used by the project's permission scheme only
* If a role gets removed from a permission scheme and users are still added to this role there are two options
** JIRA removes the role from the project and in order to this all assigned users are getting removed automatically
** JIRA leaves the role with all assigned users in the project and marks it as being not required or without effect (*preferred*)
fields.summary: See only roles in "Users and Roles" which are applied by permission scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60102].
  {panel}

Currently if you add an attachment to a task and this file has a URL in its name, Activity tab from issue view will display it as a path to the referred site.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create txt file and save it as www.atlassian.com, for example.
# Go to JIRA and create a new task.
# Add the recent created file to this Task.
# Refresh the page and then delete the attachment.
# Refresh the page once more and go to Activity Tab

h3. Current behaviour

JIRA displays the attachment as an accessible URL, that can redirects you to the referred site in case you select it.

h3. Expected Behaviour
JIRA should display the attachment name as read only (not a link).

*Affected Versions*

JIRA v7.1.0-OD-02-025
JIRA v7.2.0-OD-03-010
fields.summary: Activity tab should not display attachment's name in case it is a URL

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60101].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no way to restrict workflow triggers in a project to specific repositories.

*Example:*
Someone commits a fix with a comment such as "Implementing JIRA-12345 workaround until CORECOMPONENT-123 is fixed"
Both issues would be automatically transitioned to 'In Progress' by this comment, even though no one is actually working on CORECOMPONENT-123.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to allow auto-issue transitions to be configured / restricted by repositories.

This is the customer facing issue for https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/FUSE-2786.
fields.summary: Allow workflow trigger transitions to happen only for specific repositories

fields.description:
If I paste a URL like https://kibana.ifr.someSite.com/#/discover/Service-Data?_g=()&_a=(columns:!(name,env,merge_id),filters:!(),index:services,interval:auto,query:(query_string:(analyze_wildcard:!t,query:'*')),sort:!(name,asc)) the URL gets messed up. It gets shorted, but part of the URL ends up on the right side of the shortening. Clicking it fails, right click copy fails. 

*Work-around*
Specify the link between brackets {{[somelink]}} and it will render correctly.
 
*Conclusion*
Links to kibana queries are classic examples of this. I think JIRA also chokes on such links. Confluence might as well. Kudos for consistency, but could modern links like this get better support?

Pretty sure this has always been broken, even before version 4.0.
fields.summary: Some URLs get messed up

When a user exports to excel by clicking on 'All Fields' the date formats in Excel differ between issues (rows).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60081].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
A user who is a member of the Project Role (Administrators) which has been added to the *Administer Project* permission is unable to edit the Project Lead. According to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-project-permissions-185729636.html], the *Administer Project* permission allows any user w/ the permission to edit the Project Lead:
bq. Permission to administer a project in JIRA. This includes the ability to edit project role membership, project components, project versions and some project details ('Project Name', 'URL', 'Project Lead', 'Project Description').

However, with this bug, a user with the *Administer Project* permission is unable to edit the Project Lead. No errors -appear in the UI or- in the logs.

As of JIRA 7.2.0-OD-05, receiving the following Error when trying to change the Project Lead or Default Assignee as a Project Admin:
!EditProjectLeadorAssignee.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and grant the user Project Administration permission
# Login to the instance as the user and navigate to project settings > Users and Roles
# Click on "Edit Defaults"
# Change project lead to another user
# Click "Update"

h3. Expected Results
-The update completes and pop-up window closes.- User is able to update changes to Project Lead and you see the Project Lead correctly updated on the page. 

h3. Actual Results
-The update button does not respond. You will see a brief spinning wheel, but the "Update" button does not actually update the user.-

Receiving an error indicating "You must have global administrator rights in order to modify the project key."

Looking in the logs with {{com.atlassian.jira.security}} DEBUG, all the permissions clear:
{code}
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883949500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] BROWSE_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883951500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ADMINISTER_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883991500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] BROWSE_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883997500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ADMINISTER_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
{code}

h3.Workaround
If you add the user to the {{administrators}} group, they will be able to edit the Project Lead. Or if that is not possible, another project administrator in the {{administrators}} group can make the change.
fields.summary: Project administrator cannot edit Project Lead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60080].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If a user is created and added to a permission scheme, and then the user is later deleted (not deactivated), if the user still remains in the permission scheme before they are deleted, the permission scheme will show as a blank screen, the browser will throw a 500 error in the browser console, and the NPE will appear in the log file (shown below).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user in User Management.
# Navigate to Issues > Permission Schemes.
# Add the user you created to any permission in a permission scheme of your choice.
# After the permission has been granted, delete that new user in User Management.
# Navigate to Issues > Permission Schemes and select the permission scheme you used in step 3. The scheme will not load.

h3. Expected Results
The permission scheme should load and you should be able to edit the permissions.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log file, and the permission scheme will not load in the browser:
{noformat}
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588560500 2016-03-04 15:02:33,584 http-nio-2998-exec-555 ERROR sysadmin 902x172511x1 jvz64d 4.15.43.214,10.84.193.150,127.0.0.1 /rest/internal/2/managedpermissionscheme/10600 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588563500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588563500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.updateSchemeToReturnUsername(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:436)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588564500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.access$2200(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:58)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588611500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:331)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588612500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588613500 	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option$Some.fold(Option.java:421)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588613500 	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.flatMap(Option.java:287)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588621500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588622500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getPermissionScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:105)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588630500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.getManagedPermissionScheme(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:92)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588631500 	... 2 filtered
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588631500 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588632500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588638500 	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy550.getManagedPermissionScheme(Unknown Source)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588639500 	... 2 filtered
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
The value (user or group) needs to be removed from the scheme in the database. Use the following steps:

# Find the permission scheme ID (it will either be in the URL, or in the stack trace. In this case, you can see in the log file that it is '10600'. This value will be used in this example;
# Access JIRA's database;
# Run the below query to find invalid user entries on the permission scheme;
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM schemepermissions WHERE perm_type = 'user' AND perm_parameter NOT IN (
	SELECT lower_user_name FROM cwd_user WHERE directory_id IN (
		SELECT id FROM cwd_directory));
{code}
# Delete those entries directly through the database;
# Restart JIRA;

This will remove that user from all permission schemes they are associated with.
fields.summary: Permission Scheme 500 Error and Nullpointerexception

fields.description:
Current documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-jira-options-185729544.html
{quote}
When turned ON, you will no longer be able to create, edit or delete users/groups from within JIRA (or via email or import); but you can still assign users/groups to project roles, and create/edit/delete user properties. Additionally, JIRA will not display options for users to change their password, or edit their profile.
{quote}

This behaviour was changed as of JIRA 5.0, as indicated by the comment here:
* [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33471|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33471?focusedCommentId=627737&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-627737]
bq. Currently the only purpose of the setting is to remove the "Forgot Password"  link.

This means it will still be possible to create/edit/delete users/groups even though the option is turned ON. Hence, the documentation needs updating.
fields.summary: Documentation Fix for External User Management

The pie chart shows redundant entries in the case that a custom field has more than one custom field context. In the attached screenshot you see a pie chart with statistic type on a single select list custom field. The select list entries are the same in the different contexts. None

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60068].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA has only one mail queue and the processing of the queue is synchronous (1 by 1) and hence an item in the mail queue that is taking a very long time to process (e.g a large amount of recipients on a filter subscription could take a long time to execute) could cause other email notifications to back up considerably on the mail queue. The impact on this is that other critical notifications may be delayed at the expense of the long running filter subscription.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if the mail queue could process mails asynchronously to reduce the chance that other notifications get delayed and back up due to a long running item in the queue.

h3. Workaround 
* If you have identified notifications taking a long time to process e.g. filter subscriptions for a large number of recipients, you may want to reschedule this kind of subscriptions to run at off-peak period and not too regularly.
* It is also possible to use the *Bypass currently sending mail* feature to suspend the long running mail item to all other notifications to go through quicker.
fields.summary: Asynchronous processing of the Mail Queue

fields.description:
We encountered a bug related to JIRA Directory integration.

We have our JIRA instance connected directly to our Domain Controller - read only w/ local groups. JIRA acts as user directory for Confluence and Bitbucket. No Crowd is involved.

We are in the process of re-organizing an OU containing the groups used by JIRA for import. We moved several of these groups into a sub-OU. Once the directory synchronized, it considered these "moved" items as deleted and re-created the users. The users were flagged as "inactive" until the user in question logged back in and reconciled with the directory.

I believe that JIRA might have seen the user and did not 

This is an edge case, but a problem none-the-less. While it did not restrict access to logging in or result in lost data, it did cause a redirect loop with Confluence as seen in the linked ticket.
fields.summary: JIRA delete/recreate groups & users when moving a group into a sub-OU in AD LDAP

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to Bulk move issues on JIRA on a list that includes sub-tasks along with other issue types, it causes the following JavaScript error:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of undefined
{noformat}
This makes the project dropdown to set the target project not show up, instead a text field with a Project ID shows up.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to {{Issues > Search for issues}}
# Get a list of issues containing sub-tasks along with other issue types
# Go to {{Tools > Bulk Change}}
# Mark all issues then click on {{Next}}

h3. Expected Results

A project dropdown is shown on the UI allowing the user to choose the target project.

h3. Actual Results
An editable text field shows up on the UI with the Project ID of the target project
 
h3.Workaround

*Workaround 1*
Insert the Project ID on the field that shows up instead of the dropdown list.

*Workaround 2*
Filter for sub-tasks and move them separately.
fields.summary: Bulk move with Sub-task plus other issue types causes JS error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding a group from LDAP that contains  '&' (ampersand) char for example : *FOO&BAR* breaks the application access page

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.0
* JIRA 7.1.1
* LDAP

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group in LDAP containing  '&' (ampersand) char
# Sync the directory
# Add the group to application access

h3. Expected Results
* Group should be added without any error 

h3. Actual Results
* Error is thrown on the UI and breaks the page
 !break.png|thumbnail!  
 
h3. Notes
Issue also occurring on JIRA 7.1.1

h3.Workaround
1. Delete the group from LDAP and re-sync the user directories 
2. Delete the group from application access page rest api as described here :
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/applicationrole-put
{code}
{
    "key": "jira-software",
    "groups": [
        "jira-software-users",
        "jira-administrators"
    ]
}
{code}
fields.summary: Application Access page breaks when adding group that contains  '&' (ampersand) char

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Our JIRA installation uses the internal JIRA directory as well as (more recently) an external Active Directory that has preference over the internal one. The external AD holds users with the same username as their counterparts in the internal directory. We basically overrode the internal users with their external matches (as it is always the same person).

When searching for users in the assignee userpicker using their full name, we get duplicate results - one from each directory - for the same username. This occurs since upgrading to 7.1, we skipped 7.0 though, so it might affect that version too.

*Example*
External Directory: Doe John (j.doe)
Internal Directory: John Doe (j.doe)

Searching for "Doe" returns both results in the userpicker, even though the internal user has practically been overwritten by the external one.

h3. Steps to reproduce
- Have more than one directory with users sharing the same username and (parts of) he same full name
- Search for the users in the assignee userpicker

h3. Expected result
- Only one user for a shared username is returned in the assignee userpicker result list

h3. Actual result
- Duplicate results - one from each directory - for the same username are returned

h3. Notes
- Removing the user from all groups does not help
- Only deactivating the user in the internal directory leads to the expected result.

Since there is no way to edit/deactivate overwritten users in the "lower" directory (without moving around the directory order), this is only a clunky workaround and since this has not happened before JIRA 7, I assume and hope it's a bug and not a feature.
fields.summary: Assignee userpicker returns duplicate results for the same username from different directories

We really appreciate the work that was done to allow creating issues from tables in a Confluence requirements page, but we're lacking some function that would make it perfect for our uses.

The big one would be allowing linking sub-tasks to Story issues, much as you do with allowing linking of Story to Epic (when it works, which it's not currently due to some known bug).

Here's our use case:  When we create our Requirements Docs for a project we define several Epics, and User Stories, and we write all of the sub-tasks to fulfill the user story.  As it is now we have to manually create all of the sub-tasks (we open the Story issue and create sub-tasks one at a time).
If when we highlighted a table with our sub-tasks, and could choose a Story that existed on the page for linking, it would save us a tremendous amount of time.

If my description of this is not clear I'd love a chance to try explaining again.  Let me know.
fields.summary: Better workflow when creating JIRA issue from Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Context

We have Jira running with SSO from Crowd. Jira is behind a corporate reverse proxy (from BlueCoat) which has caching enabled but respects the Cache-control, Expire and Pragma HTTP headers.

h3. Problem

We have discovered following cases of sessions mix up where a user \[1] get the Crowd token cookie value from another user \[2] and then user \[1] can make actions in Jira as if logged in with user \[2] credentials.

h3. Details

After some investigation, we discovered that Jira, if

# a user with no Jira session
# with a valid Crowd session
# tries to get some Jira pages
# will get Jira responses which have:

* no Cache-Control headers
* have Set-Cookie: crowd.token_key headers

This behavior is dangerous as some Jira resources can be cached by the upstream reverse proxy with Set-Cookie headers; and they can be served as cached data to other users.

h3. Workaround

On the reverse proxy, disabling caching completely or selectively on responses containing Set-Cookie headers


h3. Real fix

Jira setting Cache-Control header whenever Jira sends Set-Cookie headers

Same as BSERV-8483, CONF-40945, BAM-17294
fields.summary: Responses with Set-Cookie header cached

Due to changes made to Gadget rendering implementation since JIRA 7.1 (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59892). Users terminating SSL on Apache with a self-signed certificate would now need to import the certificate into Tomcat as well, so that java trusts it.

fields.description:
The marketplace.atlassian.com version history pages for some bundled plugins do not contain the version of the plugin that was bundled with 7.1. These pages show newer plugin versions as being incompatible with 7.1.

UPM will not attempt to update these plugins due to the installed version not being listed in marketplace. In addition this can also cause confusion as the bundled version is missing and other versions show not compatible. 

h5. Example 1: 
[JIRA Importers Plugin - Version History | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin/versions]
* Bundled version = 7.1.2
* Versions before and after 7.1.2 show as being compatible up to 7.0.10.

h5. Example 2: 
[Hipchat for JIRA - Version History | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.labs.hipchat.hipchat-for-jira-plugin/versions]
* Bundled version = 7.3.3
* Versions before and after 7.3.3 show as being compatible up to 7.0.10.
** The version history has now been updated to reflect that 7.4.1 is compatible with JIRA 7.1

h5. Example 3: 
[JIRA iCalendar Plugin | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.extra.jira-ical-feed/versions]
* Bundled Version = 1.4.5
* Both 1.4.6 and 1.4.3 show compatible up to 6.4.12. Most recent version shows compatible up to 7.0.10
fields.summary: 7.1 bundled plugin versions missing from marketplace with newer plugin versions not compatible with 7.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60023].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
The supported platforms documentation for [JIRA 6.3.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/supported-platforms-683541780.html] and [6.4.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html] currently states that Java 7 and 8 are both supported. Although the application functions properly with Java 7, but there are a large number of cases - especially when it comes to medium to large instances - when the performance on Java 7 is significantly worse than it is on Java 8, not to talk about the same instance running on earlier versions of JIRA.

h4. Proposed solution
We already have a [knowledge base article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Java+8+improves+JIRA+application+performance+dramatically] that describes the performance gain on Java 8, but customers who upgrade or install JIRA will not necessarily browse through the KB space. 

We should mention the significant performance impact when using Java 7 in both the supported platforms documentation and the related upgrade documentation to clarify the situation and avoid post-mortem suggestions for customers being affected by this issue.

We should probably also evaluate removing Java 7 as supported platform for these versions, given the number of performance related issues we see.

h5. References
- [*Java 8 improves JIRA application performance dramatically*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Java+8+improves+JIRA+application+performance+dramatically]
- [JIRA 6.3.x supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/supported-platforms-683541780.html]
- [JIRA 6.4.x supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html]
- [JIRA 6.3 upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-6-3-upgrade-notes-596771073.html]
- [JIRA 6.4 upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-6-4-upgrade-notes-687014821.html]
- [Upgrading JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/upgrading-jira-185729508.html]
fields.summary: Documentation request: Indicate possible performance problems with Java 7 and JIRA 6.3.x+

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60014].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Whenever JIRA imports data (screen, workflow, anything). It firstly checks if such an element exist. If it does but cannot be reused then it creates the element with a changed name.
For example, you import a workflow but your current JIRA already contains "Ready to View" node but it differs in type. The workflow import then renames the imported node as "Ready to View - 2".
When you then proceed to import a project will find that the flow is incorrect as the project import "forgets" the "Ready to View" is now "Ready to View - 2" and the project import does not proceed.
Another example are Screens during the actual project import.
When the project import process find out that "Default" screen configuration already exist then it creates "Default - 2" then it proceeds with the project import but it associates it with "Default" rather than "Default - 2".

h3. Suggested Solutions
# Give user an option to stop importing when a change of name is necessary. Just inform the user that "Ready to View" exists but is not compatible because it has a different type.
The user then has the option to abort the import and fix the problem or he will have an option to ignore and proceed with "Ready to View - 2"
#  Having original element name. When you import a workflow and it gets renamed to "Ready to View - 2" then the project import will find out that the workflow doesn't fit the import but the incorrect elements have expected original name and the project import can proceed.
fields.summary: Project Import - Duplicate Names

The new "Users and roles" section in the project administration only displays the 5 first users in each role, which is not handy to have a global look.
There is a "show all" button for each role, but then the screen will only display all users of that unique role.
I would like to have a global view of ALL users in ALL roles, like we had in JIRA6 before.

Besides the new screen layout makes it very difficult to see all the roles/users at once, even with 5 users limit, as soon as you have many roles => you need to scroll down ... I'm not sure that displaying ALL info about each user (id, name, email, session) is a real benefit for day-to-day project management... I liked very much better the previous JIRA6 roles screen...

Regards
Gael

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60009].
  {panel}

+*OBSERVED*+
In pie charts, the percentage numbers shown are not the nearest integer to the actual value. It seems the integer shown is calculated by rounding down that real value.

*+EXPECTED+*
As an example, take a look on the image attached: In a chart with 41 issues to represent
* 31 are marked as VERIFIED. They represent 31*100/41 = 75.61% of the total. The nearest integer to this number is 76%
* 6 are marked as CLOSED. They represent 6*100/41 = 14.63% of the total. The nearest integer to this number is 15%
* 4 are marked as CLOSED. They represent 4*100/41 = 9.76% of the total. The nearest integer to this number is 10%
fields.summary: Percentage shown in charts should be the nearest integer

When installing JIRA Software with Oracle while using the driver version 12.1.0.2.0 / 12.2.0.1.0, the following error message is thrown during JIRA's start up:

h3. Workaround

Install the 12.1.0.1.0 Oracle driver instead (it can be downloaded from [here|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/features/jdbc/index-091264.html]). To install it, copy the driver to your {{JIRA_INSTALL/lib/}} folder and remove the current 12.1.0.2.0 driver.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60006].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When an application is configured in {{Administration > User Management > JIRA User Server}} to use JIRA as a user management server, it is not currently included in the Applications list in {{Administration > Application Access > Set defaults for new users}}.

h3. Suggested Solution

The applications that use JIRA as a user management server should appear in the list to make management of permissions easier for new users.
fields.summary: Linked application not displayed as option on "Set defaults for new users"
